name: df-acn
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0
body: |- wceq(wacn(c0), cab(s0, wa(wcel(c0, universe), wral(s1, co(cdif(cpw(cv(s0)), csn(emptycls)), cmap, c0), wex(s2, wral(s3, c0, wcel(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s3)), cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3)))))))))
bodyPretty: âŠ¢ AC(c0)= { s0 |(c0 âˆˆ ð•Œ âˆ§ âˆ€(s1 âˆˆ((P(s0)\ { âˆ… })[â†¦]c0), âˆƒ(s2, âˆ€(s3 âˆˆ c0,(s2 ` s3)âˆˆ(s1 ` s3)))))}
comment: Define a local and length-limited version of the axiom of choice. The definition of the predicate ` X e. AC_ A ` is that for all families of nonempty subsets of ` X ` indexed on ` A ` (i.e. functions ` A --> ~P X \ { (/) } ` ), there is a function which selects an element from each set in the family. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.)
